intro: Tetradenia acutivena, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tetradenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Tetradenia acutivena is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
